recast_workflow.catalogue¶

Functions

get_all_combinations()

Returns all possible subworkflow combinations.

get_environment_settings(step, subworkflow_name)

Returns the possible environment settings for the given subworkflow.

get_invalid_inputs(step, subworkflow_name, …)

Returns a list of the elements from the given inputs that are invalid for the given subworkflow.

get_missing_inputs(step, subworkflow_name, …)

Returns the inputs for the given subworkflow that are missing from the given inputs.

get_valid_combinations(common_inputs)

Given values for common inputs, returns all combinations of subworkflows that support those values. Each common input should be defined in recast_workflow/common_inputs.yml, in which it is associated with a set of steps. Each subworkflow for those steps is assumed to implement a common_inputs.py file with an is_valid() -> bool function. This function is called for each subworkflow to determine whether it should be included. Once the set of allowed subworkflows for these steps is determined, the set of all possible combinations is generated using the interfaces listed in description.yml for each subworkflow. Args: common_inputs: A dict where each key-value pair is of the form (input name, input value). Returns: A list of ordered dictionaries, where each ordered dictionary has key-value pairs of the form (step, subworkflow) which describe one possible subworkflow combination that is valid for the given common inputs.
